cause.description:
San Diego Coastkeeper is a locally-based non-profit organization and is San Diego’s official agency of the international Waterkeeper Alliance, which works to protect the world’s waterways.
The organization was launched in 1995, as San Diego Baykeeper, to combat chronic pollution of the San Diego Bay that transformed a once-thriving ecosystem into a highly toxic waterbody. A local, community-based advocacy group, Baykeeper became the 15th approved Waterkeeper program in the country.
After 10 years of successfully fighting pollution of San Diego’s waterways, San Diego Baykeeper became San Diego Coastkeeper in 2005 - a new name for a growing organization whose mission now encompasses protecting all of San Diego County’s bays, beaches, watersheds and ocean.
For more information, please visit www.sdcoastkeeper.org.
1. San Diego's coastline is its greatest natural resource.
2. We will balance community outreach, education, and advocacy to promote stewardship of clean water and a healthy coastal ecosystem.
cause.mission: SD Coastkeeper protects the region's bays, beaches, watersheds and ocean for the people & wildlife that depend on them.
cause.name: San Diego Coastkeeper
